channel.title: BlazeScape
channel.description:
[center][img]http://blazescape.net/img/title2/rslogo3.png[/img][/center] Hi guys, it's been a while since I touched servers. My interest in programming and lack of anything to do that is productive (after studying for outrageous amounts to fill that time) and peaked. Plus, I wanted to return the idea of BlazeScape to the private server world in a new era. Some backstory about BlazeScape itself. Started in 2006-7 by [url=http://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php?action=profile;u=438]Blazefire[/url], he developed the original concept of a Castle Wars centralized home where almost every skill could be completed within walking distance or within a set location of portals. This allowed the small player base become a tight knit community because free roam was disabled. Eventually, BlazeScape was plagued by its horrible networking and computer specs it was being run on. Blazefire started to lose interest in runescape private servers as well and ended up trying to develop different game private servers and eventually, his own game (Hillz-Game). Eventually the game was shutdown around late 2008-early 2009. Afterward, a team formed between BlazeScape moderator [url=http://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php?action=profile;u=429805]basicallyimj(esus)[/url] and [url=http://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php?action=profile;u=185695]cocoa[/url] to revive BlazeScape and appropriately dubbed the server - BlazeScape Reborn. Cocoa re-developed a deob 317 loading 377 into a near replica of Blazefire's client featuring the original music, customs, and rainbow text implementation. The source was built off of an old version of iClarity. I, myself, eventually joined the team after I dogged Cocoa on trying to get main content developed because he released the source and nearly closed the server. Eventually taking over as the lead developer, BlazeScape lasted until mid-2010 until all motivation was lost. The team took a move and began doing remakes and interest was lost immediately. I like developing custom content more than trying to remake runescape completely and I think the rest of the time felt the same. Plus, my computer crashed and I lost the source for both the 317 and 474 remakes. So, almost two years later, here I am again. Introducing an old concept with a new look. Current Team: Lead Developer - [url=http://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php?action=profile;u=121029]LilXCj[/url] Webmaster - [url=http://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php?action=profile;u=429805]Acans[/url] Website - www.blazescape.net Credits Blazefire Acans Key: + addition to existing source ! change to existing source - subtraction to existing source
+ Source and client picked + Autocache downloader adjusted + Development begins 4:00pm EST 8/4/2013
! Version set to 0.1 ! Home location set ! Magic icons for modern/ancient magicks teleports set to always on via cache ! Doors in home are works ! Home NPCs placed ! Guthix Portal class46 changed to "Training Portal" ! Slayer Tower NPCs added. ! Slayer Tower NPCs settings set to 0 TODO: Adjustments - Unused doors and objects removed from source.
! Version set to 0.2 ! Shop NPCs placed ! Coins replaced with Ecto-tokens as currency ! Ecto-tokens name changed to "BlazeScape Tickets" ! Shop system fully supports BlazeScape Tickets ! "A magic scroll" changed to "Bank Scroll" which opens your bank anywhere except in combat or in the wilderness.
! Version set to 0.21 ! Training portal teleports the player to aforementioned Slayer Tower

updates:

+ Source and client picked + Autocache downloader adjusted + Development begins 4:00pm EST 8/4/2013

! Version set to 0.2 ! Shop NPCs placed ! Coins replaced with Ecto-tokens as currency ! Ecto-tokens name changed to "BlazeScape Tickets" ! Shop system fully supports BlazeScape Tickets ! "A magic scroll" changed to "Bank Scroll" which opens your bank anywhere except in combat or in the wilderness.

item.title: BlazeScape
item.dc:creator: @Acans Acans
item.description:
@Acans wrote:

LilXCj:

Yes, it was run by Cocoa, then it was taken over by me. My name is Corey. Also known as Ituharu on BlazeScape. I was the programmer than came in halfway into Cocoa’s BlazeScape Reborn. I developed a good portion of the content of that server on my own while Cocoa was busy with using custom map data for Godwars.

Yep, Content such as Barrows, New Bosses and several skill reprogrammed. Including: Mage, Fishing, Cooking, Thieving, Crafting, Woodcutting and Fletching. I believe Cocoa did Duel Arena, Slayer (Three levels of tasks), God Wars, combat skill improvements notably Ranged, Pking area and the basic fundamentals of skills.

You also created the functions for Auto Casting with Staffs that I applied to every staff in the server, as well as unlimited elemental runes from every required staff (Something most servers at that time never had). Cocoa also made the functions for Herblore that I finished late in Reborn.

Everything from Blazescape Reborn is archived here: http://archive.blazescape.net

Blazescape 2011 is still here: http://blazescape.net

Read full topic

I developed a good portion of the content of that server on my own while Cocoa was busy with using custom map data for Godwars.

The one I know is the 317 version[/quote]

The concept of 317 is dying. I wanted to find a 474+ or at least 508 revision but I wanted to see where I could go custom content with the 718 revision by using items in different ways than intended.

item.title: BlazeScape
item.dc:creator: @LilXCj LilXCj
item.description:
@LilXCj wrote:

[center][/center]

Hi guys, it’s been a while since I touched servers. My interest in programming and lack of anything to do that is productive (after studying for outrageous amounts to fill that time) and peaked. Plus, I wanted to return the idea of BlazeScape to the private server world in a new era.

Some backstory about BlazeScape itself.

Started in 2006-7 by Blazefire, he developed the original concept of a Castle Wars centralized home where almost every skill could be completed within walking distance or within a set location of portals. This allowed the small player base become a tight knit community because free roam was disabled. Eventually, BlazeScape was plagued by its horrible networking and computer specs it was being run on. Blazefire started to lose interest in runescape private servers as well and ended up trying to develop different game private servers and eventually, his own game (Hillz-Game). Eventually the game was shutdown around late 2008-early 2009.

Afterward, a team formed between BlazeScape moderator basicallyimj(esus) and cocoa to revive BlazeScape and appropriately dubbed the server - BlazeScape Reborn. Cocoa re-developed a deob 317 loading 377 into a near replica of Blazefire’s client featuring the original music, customs, and rainbow text implementation. The source was built off of an old version of iClarity. I, myself, eventually joined the team after I dogged Cocoa on trying to get main content developed because he released the source and nearly closed the server. Eventually taking over as the lead developer, BlazeScape lasted until mid-2010 until all motivation was lost.

The team took a move and began doing remakes and interest was lost immediately. I like developing custom content more than trying to remake runescape completely and I think the rest of the time felt the same. Plus, my computer crashed and I lost the source for both the 317 and 474 remakes.

So, almost two years later, here I am again. Introducing an old concept with a new look.

Current Team:
Lead Developer - LilXCj
Webmaster - Acans

Website - www.blazescape.net

Credits
Blazefire
Acans

Key:

  • addition to existing source
    ! change to existing source
  • subtraction to existing source
